Hi,

I am contributing to bluej project which is a java IDE targeted for un=
iversity students. It is multi threaded environment. Here is a code snippet=
 that we use to invoke a test method:


Result res =3D (new JUnitCore()).ru=
n(Request.method(StudentTest.class, methodName));
if (res.wasSuccessful()) =
{
    System.out.println("\tsuccess"); 
} else {
    System.out.println("\t=
failure"); 
}


I have annotated our StudentTest class test methods with:
 =
   @Test(timeout =3D 1)

I can see that all the tests run successfully. How=
ever, one of the tests run longer than 1mS, but there is no timeout error g=
iven in the res variable.

I'm wondering if this is some weird threading is=
sue related to how we have configured our multi threaded environment. 

Any=
 suggestions? Let me know if you need any more information.

Regards,
Patri=
